newsitem.title: FINLAND: Metsa-Serla plant on fire, no casualties.
newsitem.headline: Metsa-Serla plant on fire, no casualties.

text.p: A fire broke out at 7.00 a.m. (0400 GMT) at Finnish forest industry group Metsa-Serla Oy's Jyvaskyla-Kangas office paper plant in central Finland, but it was coming under control two hours later, a spokesman said.
"It seems the fire will not spread to paper machines or the sheeting unit," said corporate communications officer Jukka-Pekka Vuori. No-one had been hurt, he said.
He could not give a full estimate of the damage, but said 2,000 tonnes of paper worth eight million markka and three million markka worth of packaging material would be lost.
"The fire should not spread, but the problem is that if it goes into the office building, it may damage data communications," Vuori added.
The plant was out of operation "for the time being" but he could not say what the full impact on production would be.
The plant's annual capacity is 190,000 tonnes of uncoated fine paper and 70,000 tonnes of speciality paper. It had not been running at full capacity in June, he said.
The fire was probably caused by roof insulation works at an old warehouse, he said.
The company will issue a statement at 11.30 a.m. (0830 GMT).
